justification: Improving air quality can aid in the conservation of biodiversity by reducing pollution that harms ecosystems and species, thus reinforcing biodiversity protection efforts.
Soil health improvement is inextricably linked to the restoration of agricultural ecosystems, as healthy soils are essential for sustainable agriculture and ecosystem services.
Reducing noise pollution can create conditions that further urban biodiversity conservation by making cities more livable for species and enhancing ecosystem services.
Improving sanitation and wastewater management can aid in biodiversity conservation by reducing water pollution and protecting aquatic ecosystems, thus reinforcing biodiversity protection efforts.
Improving water quality can aid in the restoration of marine ecosystems by reducing pollution and enhancing ecosystem services, thus reinforcing marine ecosystem restoration efforts.
Soil health improvement is inextricably linked to terrestrial ecosystem restoration, as healthy soils are essential for ecosystem services and biodiversity conservation.

Sustainable forest bioeconomy is inextricably linked to the restoration of forests, as it promotes sustainable forest management and conservation, thus supporting forest ecosystem services and biodiversity.
Improving air quality can aid in biodiversity monitoring and conservation by reducing pollution that harms species and ecosystems, thus reinforcing biodiversity protection efforts.
Soil health improvement can aid in biodiversity conservation by enhancing ecosystem services and supporting species habitats, thus reinforcing biodiversity protection efforts.
Reducing noise pollution can create conditions that further urban ecosystem restoration by making cities more livable and enhancing ecosystem services.
Improving water quality can aid in the conservation of fish species and aquatic ecosystems, thus reinforcing biodiversity protection efforts in fisheries.
Soil health improvement can aid in urban biodiversity conservation by enhancing ecosystem services and supporting species habitats, thus reinforcing biodiversity protection efforts.
